III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allegedly saw youth naked in her cell.
Investigation On 11/28/23, I spoke to Administrator 1. Allegations were
discussed. Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 had found contraband
in the girls' unit and was going to talk to them about the
consequences. Administrator 1 reported this is not the first-time
allegations were made from Youth A. Administrator 1 reported that
Youth A and her mother are attempting to remove her from
placement, and this might be the way they are attempting to do it.
On 11/28/23 I spoke to Complainant 1 via telephone. Complainant
1 reported she did not see the incident and did not provide any
more information than the current allegations.
I reviewed the video of the alleged incident on 12/1/23. The
alleged incident was dated 11/20/23 at 9:13:29pm. All the youth
are in their bedrooms with the doors closed, preparing for
bedtime. Staff 1 walks down the hallway and stops to talk at one
youth through the door. After Staff 1 talks with this youth, Staff 1
then goes to the next door, which is Youth A's door. Looks at the
door/window and quickly turns away. At 9:27, Staff 2 goes to
Youth A's door and talks through the door.
Interviews:
Youth A:
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 12/1/23. Youth A reported
that last week Staff 1 came down the hallway and looked into her
cell, said, "my bad", and walked away. Youth A reported she did
not have her clothes on and was changing. Youth A reported that
Staff 2 then came down later and apologized for Staff 1. Staff 2
reported to her that Staff 1 apologized but didn't see anything but
knew quicky to look away. Youth A reported Staff 1 has never said
or acted in a way that made her uncomfortable before.
2

Staff 1:
I interviewed Staff 1 via telephone on 12/5/23. Staff 1 reported that
he was working on the unit when they found contraband in the
girls' boxes. Staff 1 reported that their supervisor gave them
permission to go through the boxes. Four youth had items and
Staff 1 was going to the rooms of those with contraband to talk to
them. Staff 1 was under the impression that all youth were
dressed at this time. Staff 1 reported that when they are preparing
for bedtime, they go into their room and then get dressed. Staff 1
reported that Staff 2, female staff would have gone down the
hallway to make sure everyone was ready for bed. Staff 1
reported he was under the impression that was done because
Staff 2 was with him when he stated he was going to talk to the
girls. Staff 1 reported he went down the hallway and went to knock
on her door, when he noticed the outline of her body or shadow,
he quickly turned away and sent Staff 2 to talk to her about it. Staff
1 reported he told the supervisor about what happened. Staff 1
reported that a couple weeks ago he consequented Youth A and a
couple other girls and they have been discussing ways to get "him
fired."
I left a voicemail for Staff 2 on 12/1, 12/5, and 12/20/23. Staff 2 did
call back after the 12/5/23 voicemail but was then unable to be
reached, so there is no interview noted.
I reviewed Staff 1's personnel file. There is no disciplinary action in
his file and all training is up to date.
The facility does not have a policy stating males cannot supervise
female units.
Analysis Staff 1 did see Youth A without clothes on but not intentionally.
Video and both Staff 1 and Youth A's interviews all confirm that
Staff 1 turned away quickly after he looked into Youth A's
bedroom.
Consultation:
It is recommended that staff formally notify other staff on the unit
when youth are in their rooms to change, and once it has been
confirmed they are all changed so all staff on the unit are aware.
Conclusion Violation Not Established

It is recommended the license remain unchanged.
